taxonomy.name: Entity Resolution Methodologies
taxonomy.description: A taxonomy of methodologies applied to entity resolution, organized hierarchically from broad categories to specific techniques.

children.name: Rule-based Methods
children.description: Methods that use a set of deterministic rules to identify and resolve entities based on predefined criteria.

children.name: Heuristic Rules
children.description: Rules derived from expert knowledge and domain-specific insights.

children.name: String Matching Algorithms
children.description: Techniques that leverage string similarity measures to compare and resolve entities.

children.name: Probabilistic Methods
children.description: Methods that utilize probability theory to assess the likelihood of entity matches.

children.name: Bayesian Networks
children.description: Utilizes Bayesian inference to model the probability of matches between entities.

children.name: Expectation-Maximization
children.description: An iterative algorithm used to find maximum likelihood estimates in probabilistic models.

children.name: Machine Learning Methods
children.description: Approaches that apply machine learning techniques to automatically learn patterns and resolve entities.

children.name: Supervised Learning
children.description: Involves training models on labeled data to predict entity matches.

children.name: Decision Trees
children.description: A tree-like model used for classification and regression tasks.
pros: Handles both numerical and categorical data

children.name: Neural Networks
children.description: Deep learning models that can capture complex relationships in data.

children.name: Unsupervised Learning
children.description: Techniques that identify patterns in unlabeled data to resolve entities.
